intro: Rollandia longiflora var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rollandia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
